00034 
00035 /* for O_DIRECT */
00036 #ifndef _GNU_SOURCE
00037 #define _GNU_SOURCE
00038 #endif
00039 
00040 #include<stdio.h>
00041 #include<errno.h>
00042 #include<fcntl.h>
00043 #include<sys/types.h>
00044 #include<sys/stat.h>
00045 #include<unistd.h>
00046 #include<signal.h>
00047 #include<stdlib.h>
00048 #include<string.h>
00049 
00050 #define BUFFERSIZE 4096
00051 
00052 /* This flag controls termination of the main loop. */
00053 volatile sig_atomic_t keep_going = 1;
00054 
00055 /* The signal handler just clears the flag and re-enables itself. */
00056 void catch_alarm(int sig)
00057 {
00058         keep_going = 0;
00059         signal(sig, catch_alarm);
00060 }
00061 
00062 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00063 {
00064         char *file;
00065         unsigned char buf[BUFFERSIZE];
00066         int fd, i, rc;
00067         unsigned int test_time;
00068         mode_t mode = S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IRGRP | S_IWGRP | S_IROTH;
00069 
00070         if (argc != 3) {
00071                 printf("Invalid number of arguments.\n");
00072                 printf("Usage %s <file> <test_time_in_seconds>\n", argv[0]);
00073                 return -1;
00074         }
00075 
00076         file = argv[1];
00077         test_time = atoi(argv[2]);
00078 
00079         /* Establish a handler for SIGALRM signals. */
00080         signal(SIGALRM, catch_alarm);
00081 
00082         /* Set an alarm to go off in a little while. */
00083         alarm(test_time);
00084 
00085         fd = open(file, O_RDWR|O_TRUNC|O_CREAT|O_SYNC|O_LARGEFILE, mode);
00086         if (fd < 0) {
00087                 fprintf(stderr, "Error: Cannot open file named ");
00088                 perror(file);
00089                 return -1;
00090         }
00091 
00092         memset(buf, 1, BUFFERSIZE);
00093         while (keep_going) {
00094                 for (i = 0; i < 1024; i++) {
00095                         rc = write(fd, buf, BUFFERSIZE);
00096                         if (rc < 0) {
00097                                 fprintf(stderr, "Error: Write error ");
00098                                 perror(file);
00099                                 exit(-1);
00100                         } else if (rc != BUFFERSIZE) {
00101                                 fprintf(stderr, "Error: Ddidn't write all data \n");
00102                         }
00103                 }
00104 
00105                 if (ftruncate(fd, 0) < 0) {
00106                         fprintf(stderr, "Error: Truncate error ");
00107                         perror(file);
00108                         exit(-1);
00109                 }
00110         }
00111 
00112         if (close(fd) < 0) {
00113                 fprintf(stderr, "Error: Cannot close ");
00114                 perror(file);
00115                 return -1;
00116         }
00117 
00118         return 0;
00119 }
